ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. Can you tell me about your desire to live, your wish to live today? Is it moderate to strong? Weak? Or none?
Notes: 0= Moderate to strong (wish to live); 1= Weak; 2= None; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 2. Can you tell me about your wish to die? Is it moderate to strong? Weak? Or none?
Notes: 0 = No Wish to Die (None); 1 = Weak; 2 = Moderate to strong; -9=Incomplete

ElementDescription: 3. Would you say today that your reasons for living outweigh your reasons for dying?
Notes: 0= Reasons for living outweigh for dying; 1= Reasons for living/dying about equal; 2= Reasons for dying outweigh for living; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 4. What is your current desire to make an active suicide attempt, to actively harm yourself, actively kill yourself? Is there no desire at all?
Notes: 0= No desire (to make suicide attempt); 1= Weak; 2= Moderate to strong; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 5. Today do you have any passive suicidal feelings? For instance, on the one hand, would you, in fact, take precautions necessary to save your life? Would you take medicine to save your life? Would you drive safely to keep yourself alive?
Notes: 0= Would take precautions to save life (try to save my life if I found myself in a life-threatening situation); 1= Would leave life/death to chance (e.g.: carelessly crossing a busy street); 2= Would avoid or not take steps necessary to save or maintain life (avoid death if I found myself in a life-threatening situation) (e.g.: diabetic ceasing to take insulin); -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 6. Do you have thoughts of suicide for brief, fleeting periods?
Notes: 0= Brief, fleeting periods (of suicide ideation/wish); 1= Longer periods; 2 =Continuous (chronic), almost continuous, or long periods; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 7. How often do you have thoughts of suicide? Do they occur rarely, occasionally?Do the thoughts occur more frequently, that is intermittently? Do you have the thoughts all of the time or most of the time?
Notes: 0= Rare, occasional (thoughts of suicide); 1= Intermittent or frequent; 2= Persistent or continuous; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 8. What are your attitudes toward suicide? Do you reject the notion of suicide, meaning that you feel that suicide is not a good option; it's not okay to do; it's wrong?
Notes: 0= Rejecting (the idea of killing myself); 1= Ambivalent, indifferent; 2= Accepting; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 9. With regard to your suicidal thoughts, do you feel that you have control over those thoughts? Can you have the thoughts without doing anything to harm yourself?
Notes: 0= Has sense of control (over suicidal action/acting out wish); 1= Unsure of control; 2= Has no sense of control; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 10. Does thinking about anyone or anything prevent you from taking your own life?
Notes: 0= Would not attempt suicide because of a deterrent (family, friends, religion, possible injury from unsuccessful attempt, etc); 1= Some concern about deterrents; 2= Minimal or no concern about deterrents; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 11. When you think about killing yourself, what are the main reasons?
Notes: 0= To manipulate the environment or influence other people (get attention, revenge, get even with other people, make people happier, make people pay attention to me, etc); 1= Combination of 0 and 2; 2= Escape, surcease, solve problems; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 12. Have you thought of ways to kill yourself?
Notes: 0= Specific plan (to kill myself) not considered; 1= Specific plan considered, but details not worked out; 2= Specific plan details worked out, well formulated; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 13. Have you worked out the way to carry out your thoughts of suicide? Do you have the chance right now? Do you think that you'll have the chance to kill yourself soon?
Notes: 0 = Method not available, no opportunity; 1 = Method would take time/effort, opportunity not readily available; 2 = Method and opportunity available or Future opportunity or availability of method anticipated; -9=incomplete

ElementDescription: 14. Do you believe that you have the know-how, the ability, and the motivation to commit suicide? Do you know exactly what you'd have to do to cause your own death, and do you feel sure hat you would not hesitate to harm yourself?
Notes: 0= No courage, too weak, afraid, incompetent (to carry out attempt); 1= Unsure of courage, competence; 2= Sure of courage, competence; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 15. Do you expect or anticipate at some point in the future that you will actually make a suicide attempt? Are you certain that you will not make an attempt?
Notes: 0 = No, will not make attempt; 1 = Uncertain, not sure; 2 = Yes, expect to make an attempt; -9=incomplete

ElementDescription: 16. Have you taken any steps to make it possible for you to take your own life? In other words, have you actually put your method into place?
Notes: 0= No preparations (for committing suicide); 1= Partial preparations (e.g.: starting to collect pills); 2= Complete preparations (e.g.: has pills, razor, loaded gun); -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 17. Have you started or finished writing a suicide note?
Notes: 0= Have not written a suicide note; 1= Started but not completed or only thought about; 2= Completed; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 18. Have you tied up loose ends because you anticipate dying? For example, have you taken out an insurance policy or prepared a will?
Notes: 0= No arrangements (in anticipation of death); 1= Thought about or made some arrangements; 2= Made definite plans or completed arrangements; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: 19. Sometimes people hesitate to talk about their suicidal thoughts because I'll think they're crazy or I'll make them go to the hospital. Could this be going on with you? If you had thoughts about suicide, would you tell a therapist or someone close to you? Or would you hesitate?
Notes: 0= Revealed ideas openly, have not hidden desire (of contemplating suicide); 1= Held back on revealing or telling people; 2= Attempted to deceive, conceal, lie; -9= Incomplete

ElementDescription: Total Score - Scale for Suicide Ideation
Site
Week in level/study
Study ID number
Suicide attempt
Notes: 0 = I have never attempted suicide; 1 = I have attempted suicide once; 2 = I have attempted suicide two or more times; -9 = incomplete

ElementDescription: Wish to die during last suicide attempt
Notes: 0 = My wish to die during the last suicide attempt was low; 1 = My wish to die during the last suicide attempt was moderate; 2 = My wish to die during the last suicide attempt was high; -9 = incomplete

ElementDescription: total 1-5
total 6-21
MetaTrial Visit ID

Notes: 0 = Brief, fleeting periods (of suicide ideation/wish); 1 = Longer periods; 2 = Continuous (chronic), almost continuous, or long periods; -9 = Incomplete

Notes: 0 = Rejecting (the idea of killing myself); 1 = Ambivalent, indifferent; 2 = Accepting; -9 = Incomplete

Notes: 0 = To manipulate the environment or influence other people (get attention, revenge, get even with other people, make people happier, make people pay attention to me, etc.); 1 = Combination of 0 and 2; 2 = Escape, surcease, solve problems; -9 = Incomplete

Notes: 0 = Specific plan (to kill myself) not considered; 1 = Specific plan considered, but details not worked out; 2 = Specific plan details worked out, well formulated; -9 = Incomplete

Notes: 0 = Method not available, no opportunity; 1 = Method would take time/effort, opportunity not readily available; 2 = Method and opportunity available or Future opportunity or availability of method anticipated; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 14. Did you believe that you had the know-how, the ability, and the motivation to commit suicide? Did you know exactly what you''d have to do to cause your own death, and did you feel sure that you would not hesitate to harm yourself?
Notes: 0 = No courage, too weak, afraid, incompetent (to carry out attempt); 1 = Unsure of courage, competence; 2 = Sure of courage, competence; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 15. Did you expect or anticipate at some point in the future that you will actually make a suicide attempt? Were you certain that you will not make an attempt?
Notes: 0 = No, will not make attempt; 1 = Uncertain, not sure; 2 = Yes, expect to make an attempt; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 16. Did you take any steps to make it possible for you to take your own life? In other words, had you actually put your method into place?
Notes: 0 = No preparations (for committing suicide); 1 = Partial preparations (e.g.: starting to collect pills); 2 = Complete preparations (e.g.: has pills, razor, loaded gun); -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 17. Over the past 2 weeks did you start or finish writing a suicide note?
Notes: 0 = Have not written a suicide note; 1 = Started but not completed or only thought about; 2 = Completed; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 19. (Over the past 2 weeks) Sometimes people hesitate to talk about their suicidal thoughts because other people will think they''re crazy or they will have to stay in the hospital. Could this have gone on with you? With your thoughts about suicide, did you tell someone close to you? Or did you hesitate?
Notes: 0 = Revealed ideas openly, have not hidden desire (of contemplating suicide); 1 = Held back on revealing or telling people; 2 = Attempted to deceive, conceal, lie; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: Total Score - Scale for Suicide Ideation (Over past 2 weeks)
Recent Days Suicidal
Notes: 1 = One day; 2 = More than one day

ElementDescription: Recent Suicidal Date
1. Can you tell me about your desire to live, your wish to live on that day? Was it moderate to strong? Weak? Or none?
Notes: 0 = Moderate to strong (wish to live); 1 = Weak; 2 = None; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 2. Can you tell me about your wish to die on that day? Was it moderate to strong? Weak? Or none?
Notes: 0 = No wish to die; 1 = Weak; 2 = Moderate to strong; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 3. Would you say that your reasons for living outweigh your reasons for dying? Would you say that your reasons for dying outweighed your reasons for living? Or were they about equal?
Notes: 0 = Reasons for living outweigh for dying; 1 = Reasons for living/dying about equal; 2 = Reasons for dying outweigh for living; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 4. On that day what was your desire to make an active suicide attempt, to actively harm yourself, actively kill yourself? Was there no desire at all? Was it a weak desire, or moderate to strong?
Notes: 0 = No desire (to make suicide attempt); 1 = Weak; 2 = Moderate to strong; -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: 5. On that day did you have any passive suicidal feelings? For instance, on the one hand, would you, in fact, take precautions necessary to save your life? Would you take medicine to save your life? Would you drive safely to keep yourself alive?
Notes: 0 = Would take precautions to save life (try to save my life if I found myself in a life-threatening situation); 1 = Would leave life/death to chance (e.g.: carelessly crossing a busy street); 2 = Would avoid or not take steps necessary to save or maintain life (avoid death if I found myself in a life-threatening situation) (e.g.: diabetic ceasing to take insulin); -9 = Incomplete

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Attitude toward ideation/wish - When these thoughts come into your head, do you reject them, feel indifferent to them, or accept them?
Past 24 hours: Control of suicidal action/acting out wish - Do you feel you have the control over these suicidal thoughts?
Notes: 0= Has sense of control; 1= Unsure of control; 2= Has no sense of control

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Deterrents to active attempt (e.g., family, religion, irreversibility) - What things would stop you from making a suicide attempt? Do you have family members or friends you would be concerned about? Would these concerns prevent you from making an attempt?
Notes: 0= Would not attempt because of a deterrent; 1= Some concern about deterrents; 2= Minimal or no concern about deterrents

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Reasons for contemplated attempt - If you were to attempt suicide, would it be to escape your problems or so that people would understand how bad you feel? Or both?
Notes: 0= To manipulate the environment, get attention, revenge; 1= Combination of 0 and 2; 2= Escape, surcease, solve problems

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Method, specificity/planning of contemplated attempt - Have you made a plan of how you would make an attempt?
Notes: 0= Not considered; 1= Considered, but details not worked out; 2= Details worked out well/formulated

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Method, availability /opportunity for contemplated attempt
Notes: 0= Method not available, no opportunity; 1= Method would take time/effort, opportunity not readily available; 2= Method and opportunity available/Future opportunity or availability of method anticipated

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Sense of ''capability'' to carry out attempt - Do you feel you would be able to do it?
Notes: 0= No courage, too weak, afraid, incompetent; 1= Unsure of courage, competence; 2= Sure of competence, courage

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Expectancy/anticipation of actual attempt - Do you think you will attempt suicide?
Past 24 hours: Actual preparation for contemplated attempt - Have you made any preparations to make an attempt?
Notes: 0= None; 1= Partial (e.g., starting to collect pills); 2= Complete (e.g., had pills, loaded gun)

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Suicide note - Have you written a suicide note?
Notes: 0= None; 1= Started by not completed, only thought about; 2= Completed

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Final acts in anticipation of death (e.g., insurance, will)
Notes: 0= None; 1= Thought about or made some arrangements; 2= Made definite plans or completed arrangements

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Deception/concealment of contemplated suicide
Notes: 0= Revealed ideas openly; 1= Held back on revealing; 2= Attempted to deceive, conceal, lie

ElementDescription: Scale for Suicide Ideation - Current (SSI-C) Total Score
Notes: Sum of items ssi_c_1 through ssi_c_19

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Wish to live - How strong is your wish to live?
Past 24 hours: Wish to die - How strong is your wish to die?
Past 24 hours: Reasons for living/dying - Do you think your reasons for living outweigh dying?
Notes: 0= Reasons for living outweigh dying; 1= About equal; 2= Reasons for dying outweigh living

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Desire to make active suicide attempt - How strong is your desire to make a suicide attempt?
Past 24 hours: Passive suicidal desire - You walk past the train tracks and the train is coming, you trip and fall. Do you get up?
Notes: 0= Would take precautions to save life; 1= Would leave life/death to chance; 2= Would avoid steps necessary to save or maintain life

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Time dimension, duration of suicide ideation/wish - When suicidal thoughts come into your mind, how long do they last? Are they fleeting, lasting only a few minutes, or are they longer?
Notes: 0= Brief, fleeting periods; 1= Longer periods; 2= Continuous (chronic) or almost continuous

ElementDescription: Past 24 hours: Time dimension, frequency of suicide - How often do these thoughts occur?
Notes: 0= Rare, occasional; 1= Intermittent; 2= Persistent or continuous

ElementDescription: In the last week, would you say that you accept or reject the idea of killing yourself?
Notes: 0= I do not accept the idea of killing myself; 1= I neither accept nor reject the idea of killing myself; 2= I accept the idea of killing myself

ElementDescription: In the last week, how much have you felt that you could keep yourself from attempting suicide?
Notes: 0= I can keep myself from committing suicide; 2= I am unsure that I can keep myself from committing suicide; 3= I cannot keep myself from committing suicide

ElementDescription: Deterrents to active attempt (e.g., family, religion, irreversibility)
Notes: 0= I would not have killed myself because of my family, friends, religion, possible injury from an unsuccessful attempt, etc; 1= I was somewhat concerned about killing myself because of my family, friends, religion, possible injury from an unsuccessful attempt, etc; 2= I was not or only a little concerned about killing myself because of my family, friends, religion, possible injury from an unsuccessful attempt, etc

ElementDescription: Reason for contemplated attempt
Notes: 0= My reasons for wanting to commit suicide were primarily aimed at influencing other people, such as getting even with people, making people happier, making people pay attention to me, etc; 1= My reasons for wanting to commit suicide were not only aimed at influencing other people, but also represent a way of solving my problems; 2= My reasons for wanting to commit suicide were primarily based upon escaping from my problems

ElementDescription: Method: Specificity planning of contemplated attempt
Notes: 0= I had no specific plan about how to kill myself; 1= I had considered ways of killing myself, but have not worked out the details; 2= I had a specific plan for killing myself

ElementDescription: Method: Availability or opportunity for contemplated attempt
Notes: 0= I did not have access to a method or an opportunity to kill myself; 1= The method that I would have used for committing suicide took time, and I really did not have a good opportunity to use this method; 2= I had access or anticipated having access to the method that I chose for killing myself and also had or the opportunity to use it

ElementDescription: Intent: Courage
Notes: 0= I do not have the courage or the ability to commit suicide; 1= I am unsure that I have the courage or the ability to commit suicide; 2= I have the courage and the ability to commit suicide

ElementDescription: Intent: Expectation
Notes: 0= I did not expect to make a suicide attempt; 1= I was unsure that I could make a suicide attempt; 2= I was sure that I could make a suicide attempt

ElementDescription: Preparations
Notes: 0= I had made no preparations for committing suicide; 1= I had made some preparations for committing suicide; 2= I had almost finished or completed my preparations for committing suicide

ElementDescription: Suicide Note
Notes: 0= I had not written a suicide note; 1= I had thought about writing a suicide note or had started to write one, but had not completed it; 2= I had completed a suicide note

ElementDescription: Arrangements After Death
Notes: 0= I had made no arrangements for what will happen after I had committed suicide; 1= I had thought about making some arrangements for what will happen after I had committed suicide; 2= I had made definite arrangements for what will happen after I had committed suicide

ElementDescription: Hide Desire to Kill Self
Notes: 0= I had not hidden my desire to kill myself from people; 1= I held back telling people about wanting to kill myself; 2= I attempted to hide, conceal, or lie about wanting to commit suicide

ElementDescription: In the past week, how would you rate your wish to live?
Notes: 0= I have a moderate to strong wish to live; 1= I have a weak wish to live; 2= I have no wish to live

ElementDescription: In the last week, how would you rate your wish to die?
Notes: 0= I have no wish to die; 1= I have a weak wish to die; 2= I have a moderate to strong wish to die

ElementDescription: In the last week, would you say that your reasons for living outweigh your reasons dying, or your reasons for dying outweigh your reasons for living, or that your reasons for living or dying are about the same?
Notes: 0= My reasons for living outweigh my reasons for dying; 1= My reasons for living and dying are equal; 2= My reasons for dying outweigh my reasons for living

ElementDescription: In the last week, how strong has your desire been to kill yourself?
Notes: 0= I have no desire to kill myself; 1= I have a weak desire to kill myself; 2= I have a strong desire to kill myself

ElementDescription: In the past week, would you try to save your life if you found yourself in a life-threatening situation?
Notes: 0= I would try to save my life if I found myself in a life-threatening situation; 1= I would take a chance on life or death if I found myself in a life-threatening situation; 2= I would not take steps necessary to avoid death if I found myself in a life-threatening situation

ElementDescription: In the past week, how long do your thoughts about killing yourself last?
Notes: 0= I have brief periods of thinking about killing myself which pass quickly; 1= I have periods of thinking about killing myself which last moderate amounts of time; 2= I have long periods of thinking about killing myself

ElementDescription: In the last week, how often do you think about killing yourself?
Notes: 0= I rarely or occasionally think about killing myself; 1= I have frequent thoughts about killing myself; 2= I continuously think about killing myself

ElementDescription: Was the participant's provider informed? If no, why not?
Was the participant's provider informed - Who?
Was the participant's provider informed - Date
Was the participant's provider informed - Time
Was the participant's provider informed - How
Was the participant's provider informed - What type of provider?
What were the recommendations made by the clinical research team?

ElementDescription: What were the recommendations made by the clinical research team? Other, specify

Narrative - Briefly summarize what the participant endorsed, factors that indicated risk and protection from subsequent suicidal behavior, your safety planning process (if applicable), your estimation of their ability to stay safe, the team's recommendations, and the family's response to those recommendations
Last 2 weeks - Wish to be Dead - Subject endorses thoughts about a wish to be dead or not alive anymore, or wish to fall asleep and not wake up.
Last 2 weeks - Wish to be Dead - If yes, describe

Last 2 weeks - Non-Specific Active Suicidal Thoughts - General non-specific thoughts of wanting to end one's life/commit suicide (e.g., ''I have thought about killing myself'') without thoughts of ways to kill oneself/associated methods, intent, or plan during the assessment period.
Last 2 weeks - Non-Specific Active Suicidal Thoughts - If yes, describe

Last 2 weeks - Active Suicidal Ideation with Any Methods (not Plan) without Intent to Act - Subject endorses thoughts of suicide and has thought of at least one method during the assessment period. This is different than a specific plan with time, place or method details worked out (e.g. thought of method to kill self but not a specific plan). Includes person who would say, ''I thought about taking an overdose but I never made a specific plan as to when, where or how I would actually do it... and I would never go through with it.''
Last 2 weeks - Active Suicidal Ideation with Any Methods (not Plan) without Intent to Act) - If yes, describe

Last 2 weeks - Active Suicidal Ideation with Some Intent to Act, without Specific Plan - Active suicidal thoughts of killing oneself and subject reports having some intent to act on such thoughts, as opposed to 'I have the thoughts but I definitely will not do anything about them.''
Last 2 weeks - Active Suicidal Ideation with Some Intent to Act, without Specific Plan - If yes, describe
Last 2 weeks - Active Suicidal Ideation with Specific Plan and Intent - Thoughts of killing oneself with details of plan fully or partially worked out and subject has some intent to carry it out.
Last 2 weeks - Active Suicidal Ideation with Specific Plan and Intent - If yes, describe
Based on other factors related to the participant's clinical risk, would you like to proceed with Part A: Risk Characterization?
Was a Clinical Supervisor contacted?

Past 48 hours - Method: Availability/Opportunity for contemplated attempt - Have you worked out the way to carry out your thoughts of suicide? Do you have the chance right now? Do you think you will have the chance to kill yourself soon?
Notes: 0= Method not available, not opportunity; 1= Method would take time and effort, opportunity not readily available; 2= Method and opportunity available

Notes: 0= No sense of ability to carry out; 1= Some sense of ability to carry out, unsure of ability to carry out; 2= Sure of sense of ability to carry out

ElementDescription: Past 48 hours - Sense of ''capability'' to carry out attempt - Comments
Past 48 hours - Expectancy, anticipation of actual participation - Do you expect or anticipate that you will actually make a suicide attempt? Are you certain that you will make an attempt?
Past 48 hours - Expectancy, anticipation of actual participation - Comments
Timeframe a suicide attempt is expected
Notes: 0= Less than 24 hours; 1= 24-48 hours; 2= Greater than 48 hours

ElementDescription: Timeframe a suicide attempt is expected - Comments

Notes: 0= None; 1= Partial (e.g., starting to collect pills, started to write note); 2= Complete (e.g., had pills, loaded gun)

ElementDescription: Past 48 hours - Actual preparation for contemplated attempt - Comments

Suicide Risk Management Protocol - Risk Assessment
Notes: 1= Low (current ideation is endorsed within the past 3 months but not in the past 2 weeks); 2= Moderate (current ideation is endorsed within the past 2 weeks without method or plan); 3= High (current ideation is endorsed within the past 2 weeks with method or plan); 4= Immediate (participant expects to make an attempt within the next 48 hours)
